explanation:
Agent A is incorrect that this is a MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 violation. Rule 21.17 concerns use of the string-handling functions from <string.h> in ways that can access beyond the bounds of objects referenced by their pointer parameters (examples: memcpy, strcpy, strlen, etc.). strerror does not take a pointer parameter (it takes an int errnum and returns a pointer to an internal static message), so the rule as written (which focuses on accesses via pointer parameters) does not apply to this misuse of strerror.

That said, the code does have a real bug: sched_setscheduler() returns -1 on failure and sets errno, so passing ret to strerror is semantically wrong and will produce an incorrect diagnostic message. The correct behaviour is to check the return value and then use strerror(errno) (or use strerror_r) when reporting the failure. This is a correctness issue, but not a violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
